formattedAddress: 370 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 370 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027-3132, USA

editorialSummary.text: Cozy destination turning out plentiful custom noodle plates, plus dumplings & wontons.

originalText.text:
Upon entry, the climate was cool and pleasant on this hot muggy day. I browsed over the menu and realized that they have an assortment of handmade noodles. I chose the Shrimp Wontons and the Bro Sliders. I noticed that they have an "A" rating in the window. That is always a plus. There are no tables to sit at. However, you can pull up a barstool to the countertop and dine there. The food came and it was wonderful. I will submit a video along with this review. Those "Bro Sliders" with the stewed pork and dusted with cilantro were amazingly flavorful. And the Shrimp Wontons with the veggie broth, scallions, mild pepper, and bok choy was perfectly put together ❤️

I recommend this place for a quick bite to eat and in-home delivery choice.

originalText.text:
I've only ordered the Herbal Beef soup twice as of today and it is absolutely fabulous.
But I found a piece of plastic when I got down to the just the broth.  I could have been feeding my 2 yr old grandson the soup and would have choked on the plastic.
Please just be mindful of the little things.

originalText.text: The best hand pulled noodles in the city full stop. Legitimately better than 90% fair you would find in Asia. If you are a fan of spice and noodles this is a must visit and worth the trip to Harlem. Everything is worth trying. Even the basic stir fry beef knocks it out of the park. 10/10 noodles, 10/10 flavoring. The spice hits hard like it should! Very generous portions - but don’t skimp on the appetizers! Only downside is inside seating isn’t the most exciting. But what you get for lack of ambience you get back in authentic taste.

originalText.text:
Food 9/10
Absolute FIRE. We ordered a lot of food, including the cumin lamb hand-pulled noodles, some dumplings, and overall it was an extremely filling meal. One portion lasted me multiple meals. The noodles were perfectly bouncy and QQ, the amount of meat they put in each bowl was way more than I had expected. Even though it was delivery, it still tasted very fresh. Bursting with flavor and texture. I would definitely recommend, can’t want to reorder from them again.

Atmosphere and Service: N/A

originalText.text: Portions are American sized so bring a friend and order only one noodle dish. See the picture below for an idea of the portion size. The cost of noodles, 2 bao sliders, and peach tea (22oz) was about $33 including 20% tip. It's pretty costly but the food was delicious. We ordered the bao sliders with lamb filling, cilantro, and some hot chili oil. The sliders were very flavorful and the noodles were definitely delicious. This place is one of the rare noodle places in Central Harlem so if you're in the area and craving noodles, they've got you covered. The place is pretty busy with deliveries so you know it's good.
